module.name: dateutils
module.descr: DateUtils contains a large number of date/time manipulation routines, all based on the TDateTime type. There are routines for date/time math, for comparing dates and times, for composing dates and decomposing dates in their constituent parts.

element.name: SysUtils
element.short: Exception support

element.name: Math
element.short: Math support

element.name: Types
element.short: Basic types

element.name: DaysPerWeek
element.short: Number of days in a week.

element.name: WeeksPerFortnight
element.short: Number of weeks in fortnight

element.name: MonthsPerYear

element.name: YearsPerDecade

element.name: YearsPerCentury
element.short: Number of years in a century

element.name: YearsPerMillennium

element.short: Average number of days in a month, measured over a year. Used in .

element.short: Average number of days in a year, measured over 4 years. Used in .

element.name: DateOf
element.short: Extract the date part from a DateTime indication.

descr.p: DateOf extracts the date part from AValue and returns the result.
Since the TDateTime is actually a double with the date part encoded in the integer part, this operation corresponds to a call to Trunc.

element.name: DateOf.Result
element.short: Date part of AValue.

element.name: DateOf.AValue
element.short: Datetime to extract date from

element.name: TimeOf
element.short: Extract the time part from a DateTime indication.

descr.p: TimeOf extracts the time part from AValue and returns the result.
Since the TDateTime is actually a double with the time part encoded in the fractional part, this operation corresponds to a call to Frac.

element.name: TimeOf.Result
element.short: Time part of AValue.

element.name: TimeOf.AValue
element.short: Datetime to extract time from

element.name: IsInLeapYear
element.short: Determine whether a date is in a leap year.
element.descr: IsInLeapYear returns True if the year part of AValue is leap year, or False if not.

element.name: IsInLeapYear.Result
element.short: True if AValue is in a leap year, False if not.

element.name: IsInLeapYear.AValue
element.short: Date to be checked.

element.name: IsPM
element.short: Determine whether a time is PM or AM.
element.descr: IsPM returns True if the time part of AValue is later then 12:00 (PM, or afternoon).

element.name: IsPM.Result
element.short: True if the time part of AValue is PM (afternoon).

element.name: IsPM.AValue
element.short: Time to check.

element.name: IsValidDate
element.short: Check whether a set of values is a valid date indication.

descr.p: IsValidDate returns True when the values AYear, AMonth, ADay form a valid date indication. If one of the values is not valid (e.g. the day is invalid or does not exist in that particular month), False is returned.
AYear must be in the range 1..9999 to be valid.

element.name: IsValidDate.Result
element.short: True if the given values form a valid date, False if not.

element.name: IsValidDate.AYear
element.short: Year value

element.name: IsValidDate.AMonth
element.short: Month in the year

element.name: IsValidDate.ADay
element.short: Day in the month

element.name: IsValidTime
element.short: Check whether a set of values is a valid time indication.

element.name: IsValidTime.Result
element.short: True if the given values form a valid time, False if not.
element.descr: IsValidTime returns True when the values AHour, AMinute, ASecond and AMilliSecond form a valid time indication. If one of the values is not valid (e.g. the seconds are larger than 60), False is returned.

element.name: IsValidTime.AHour
element.short: Hour of the day.

element.name: IsValidTime.AMinute
element.short: Minute in the hour

element.name: IsValidTime.ASecond
element.short: Second in the minute

element.name: IsValidTime.AMilliSecond
element.short: Milliseconds in the second

element.name: IsValidDateTime
element.short: Check whether a set of values is a valid date and time indication.

descr.p: IsValidTime returns True when the values AYear, AMonth, ADay, AHour, AMinute, ASecond and AMilliSecond form a valid date and time indication. If one of the values is not valid (e.g. the seconds are larger than 60), False is returned.
AYear must be in the range 1..9999 to be valid.

element.name: IsValidDateTime.Result
element.short: True if the given values form a valid date/time pair, False if not.

element.name: IsValidDateTime.AYear
element.short: Year value

element.name: IsValidDateTime.AMonth
element.short: Month in the year

element.name: IsValidDateTime.ADay
element.short: Day in the month

element.name: IsValidDateTime.AHour
element.short: Hour of the day

element.name: IsValidDateTime.AMinute
element.short: Minute in the hour

element.name: IsValidDateTime.ASecond
element.short: Second in the minute

element.name: IsValidDateTime.AMilliSecond
element.short: Milliseconds in the second

element.name: IsValidDateDay
element.short: Check whether a given year/day of year combination is a valid date.

descr.p: IsValidDateDay returns True if AYear and ADayOfYear form a valid date indication, or False otherwise.
AYear must be in the range 1..9999 to be valid.
The ADayOfYear value is checked to see whether it falls within the valid range of dates for AYear.

element.name: IsValidDateDay.Result
element.short: True if the given combination is a valid date, False otherwise.

element.name: IsValidDateDay.AYear
element.short: Year

element.name: IsValidDateDay.ADayOfYear
element.short: Day in the year

element.name: IsValidDateWeek
element.short: Check whether a given year/week/day of the week combination is a valid day.

descr.p: IsValidDateWeek returns True if AYear, AWeekOfYear and ADayOfWeek form a valid date indication, or False otherwise.
AYear must be in the range 1..9999 to be valid.
The ADayOfWeek,ADayOfWeek values are checked to see whether the combination falls within the valid range of weeks for AYear.

element.name: IsValidDateWeek.Result
element.short: True if the given combination is a valid date, False otherwise.

element.name: IsValidDateWeek.AYear
element.short: Year

element.name: IsValidDateWeek.AWeekOfYear
element.short: Week in the year

element.name: IsValidDateWeek.ADayOfWeek
element.short: Day in the week

element.name: IsValidDateMonthWeek
element.short: Check whether a given year/month/week/day of the week combination is a valid day

descr.p: IsValidDateMonthWeek returns True if AYear, AMonth AWeekOfMonth and ADayOfWeek form a valid date indication, or False otherwise.
AYear must be in the range 1..9999 to be valid.
The AWeekOfMonth,ADayOfWeek values are checked to see whether the combination falls within the valid range of weeks for the AYear,AMonth combination.

element.name: IsValidDateMonthWeek.Result
element.short: True if the given combination is a valid date, False otherwise.

element.name: IsValidDateMonthWeek.AYear
element.short: Year

element.name: IsValidDateMonthWeek.AMonth
element.short: Month of the year

element.name: IsValidDateMonthWeek.AWeekOfMonth
element.short: Week of the month.

element.name: IsValidDateMonthWeek.ADayOfWeek
element.short: Day in the week.

element.name: WeeksInYear
element.short: return the number of weeks in the year, given a date

descr.p: WeeksInYear returns the number of weeks in the year part of AValue. The return value is either 52 or 53.
descr.remark: The first week of the year is determined according to the ISO 8601 standard: It is the first week that has at least 4 days in it, i.e. it includes a thursday.

element.name: WeeksInYear.Result
element.short: Number of weeks.

element.name: WeeksInYear.AValue
element.short: Day in the year.

element.name: WeeksInAYear
element.short: Return the number of weeks in a given year

descr.p: WeeksInAYear returns the number of weeks in the year AYear. The return value is either 52 or 53.
descr.remark: The first week of the year is determined according to the ISO 8601 standard: It is the first week that has at least 4 days in it, i.e. it includes a thursday.

element.name: WeeksInAYear.Result
element.short: Number of weeks in AYear

element.name: WeeksInAYear.AYear
element.short: A (valid) year.

element.name: DaysInYear
element.short: Return the number of days in the year in which a date occurs.

descr.p: daysInYear returns the number of days in the year part of AValue. The return value is either 365 or 366.

element.name: DaysInYear.Result
element.short: Number of days in the year in which AValue occurs.

element.name: DaysInYear.AValue
element.short: Date in year of which to calculate the number of days.

element.name: DaysInAYear
element.short: Number of days in a particular year.

descr.p: DaysInAYear returns the number of weeks in the year AYear. The return value is either 365 or 366.

element.name: DaysInAYear.Result
element.short: Number of days in year AYear.

element.name: DaysInAYear.AYear
element.short: Year to return the number of days from

element.name: DaysInMonth
element.short: Return the number of days in the month in which a date occurs.

descr.p: DaysInMonth returns the number of days in the month in which AValue falls. The return value takes leap years into account.

element.name: DaysInMonth.Result
element.short: Number of days in the month in which AValue occurs.

element.name: DaysInMonth.AValue
element.short: Date in month of which to calculate the number of days.

element.name: DaysInAMonth
element.short: Number of days in a month of a certain year.

descr.p: DaysInYMonth returns the number of days in the month AMonth in the yearAYear. The return value takes leap years into account.

element.name: DaysInAMonth.Result
element.short: The number of days in month AMonth, in year AYear.

element.name: DaysInAMonth.AYear
element.short: Year in which the month occurs.

element.name: DaysInAMonth.AMonth
element.short: Month of which the number of days should be returned.

element.name: Today
element.short: Return the current date

descr.p: Today is an alias for the Date function in the sysutils unit.
For an example, see

element.name: Today.Result
element.short: Current day as TDateTime.

element.name: Yesterday
element.short: Return the previous day.
element.descr: Yesterday returns yesterday's date. Yesterday is determined from the system clock, i.e. it is -1.

element.name: Yesterday.Result
element.short: Previous day as TDateTime.

element.name: Tomorrow
element.short: Return the next day
element.descr: Tomorrow returns tomorrow's date. Tomorrow is determined from the system clock, i.e. it is +1.

element.name: Tomorrow.Result
element.short: Next day as TDateTime.

element.name: IsToday
element.short: Check whether a given date is today.
element.descr: IsToday returns True if AValue is today's date, and False otherwise.

element.name: IsToday.Result
element.short: True if AValue is today, False otherwise.

element.name: IsToday.AValue
element.short: Date to check, may contain a time part.

element.name: IsSameDay
element.short: Check if two date/time indications are the same day.
element.descr: IsSameDay checks whether AValue and ABasis have the same date part, and returns True if they do, False if not.

element.name: IsSameDay.Result
element.short: True if AValue and ABasis are on the same day, False otherwise..

element.name: IsSameDay.AValue
element.short: First date/time

element.name: IsSameDay.ABasis
element.short: Second date/time

element.name: PreviousDayOfWeek
element.short: Given a day of the week, return the previous day of the week.

descr.p: PreviousDayOfWeek returns the previous day of the week. If the current day is the first day of the week (1) then the last day will be returned (7).
descr.remark: Note that the days of the week are in ISO notation, i.e. 1-based.

element.name: PreviousDayOfWeek.Result
element.short: The day of the week prior to DayOfWeek

element.name: PreviousDayOfWeek.DayOfWeek
element.short: Day of the week.

element.name: YearOf
element.short: Extract the year from a given date.
element.descr: YearOf returns the year part of the AValue date/time indication. It is a number between 1 and 9999.

element.name: YearOf.Result
element.short: Year part of AValue

element.name: YearOf.AValue
element.short: Date to extract year from.

element.name: MonthOf
element.short: Extract the month from a given date.

descr.p: MonthOf returns the month part of the AValue date/time indication. It is a number between 1 and 12.
For an example, see

element.name: MonthOf.Result
element.short: Month part of AValue

element.name: MonthOf.AValue
element.short: Date to extract month from.

element.name: WeekOf
element.short: Extract week (of the year) from a given date.

descr.p: WeekOf returns the week-of-the-year part of the AValue date/time indication. It is a number between 1 and 53.
For an example, see

element.name: WeekOf.Result
element.short: Week part of AValue.

element.name: WeekOf.AValue
element.short: Date to extract week from.

element.name: DayOf
element.short: Extract the day (of month) part from a DateTime value

descr.p: DayOf returns the day of the month part of the AValue date/time indication. It is a number between 1 and 31.
For an example, see

element.name: DayOf.Result
element.short: Day of month part of AValue.

element.name: DayOf.AValue
element.short: Date to extract day of.

element.name: HourOf
element.short: Extract the hour part from a DateTime value.

descr.p: HourOf returns the hour of the day part of the AValue date/time indication. It is a number between 0 and 23.
For an example, see

element.name: HourOf.Result
element.short: Hour part of AValue.

element.name: HourOf.AValue
element.short: Date/time value to extract hour from.

element.name: MinuteOf
element.short: Extract the minute part from a DateTime value.

descr.p: MinuteOf returns the minute of the hour part of the AValue date/time indication. It is a number between 0 and 59.
For an example, see

element.name: MinuteOf.Result
element.short: Minute part of AValue.

element.name: MinuteOf.AValue
element.short: Date/time value to extract minute from.

element.name: SecondOf
element.short: Extract the second part from a DateTime value.

descr.p: SecondOf returns the second of the minute part of the AValue date/time indication. It is a number between 0 and 59.
For an example, see

element.name: SecondOf.Result
element.short: Second part of AValue.

element.name: SecondOf.AValue
element.short: Date/time value to extract second from.

element.name: MilliSecondOf
element.short: Extract the millisecond part from a DateTime value.

descr.p: MillisecondOf returns the second of the minute part of the AValue date/time indication. It is a number between 0 and 999.
For an example, see

element.name: MilliSecondOf.Result
element.short: Millisecond part of AValue.

element.name: MilliSecondOf.AValue
element.short: Date/time value to extract millisecond from.

element.name: StartOfTheYear
element.short: Return the first day of the year, given a date in this year.
element.descr: StartOfTheYear extracts the year part of AValue and returns a TDateTime value with the date of the first day of that year (January 1), as the function.

element.name: StartOfTheYear.Result
element.short: First day of the year as a TDateTime value.

element.name: StartOfTheYear.AValue
element.short: Date in year of which to return the start

element.name: EndOfTheYear
element.short: Calculate a DateTime value representing the last day of a year, given a date in that year.
element.descr: EndOfTheYear extracts the year part of AValue and returns a TDateTime value with the date of the last day of that year (December 31), as the function.

element.name: EndOfTheYear.Result
element.short: DateTime value representing the end of the year in which AValue falls.

element.name: EndOfTheYear.AValue
element.short: Date in the year of which the end should be calculated

element.name: StartOfAYear
element.short: Return the first day of a given year.
element.descr: StartOfAYear returns a TDateTime value with the date of the first day of the year AYear (January 1).

element.name: StartOfAYear.Result
element.short: First day of AYear as a TDateTime

element.name: StartOfAYear.AYear
element.short: Year to get first date from.

element.name: EndOfAYear
element.short: Calculate a DateTime value representing the last day of a year
element.descr: StartOfAYear returns a TDateTime value with the date of the last day of the year AYear (December 31).

element.name: EndOfAYear.Result
element.short: DateTime representing the last day of AYear.

element.name: EndOfAYear.AYear
element.short: Year to calculate last day from

element.name: StartOfTheMonth
element.short: Calculate the first day of the month, given a date in that month.
element.descr: StartOfTheMonth extracts the year and month parts of AValue and returns a TDateTime value with the date of the first day of that year and month as the function.

element.name: StartOfTheMonth.Result
element.short: First day of month as a TDateTime value.

element.name: StartOfTheMonth.AValue
element.short: Date to return first of month from

element.name: EndOfTheMonth
element.short: Calculate a DateTime value representing the last day of the month, given a day in that month.
element.descr: EndOfTheMonth extracts the year and month parts of AValue and returns a TDateTime value with the date of the first day of that year and month as the function.

element.name: EndOfTheMonth.Result
element.short: DateTime value representing the last day of the month in which AVAlue is a day.

element.name: EndOfTheMonth.AValue
element.short: Day in the month of which the last day should be returned.

element.name: StartOfAMonth
element.short: Return first date of month, given a year/month pair.
element.descr: StartOfAMonth e returns a TDateTime value with the date of the first day of the month indicated by the AYear, AMonth pair.

element.name: StartOfAMonth.Result
element.short: First day of the month AMonth in AYear

element.name: StartOfAMonth.AYear
element.short: A year.

element.name: StartOfAMonth.AMonth
element.short: Month in the year.

element.name: EndOfAMonth
element.short: Calculate a datetime value representing the last day of the indicated month
element.descr: EndOfAMonth e returns a TDateTime value with the date of the last day of the month indicated by the AYear, AMonth pair.

element.name: EndOfAMonth.Result
element.short: DateTime value indicating the last day of AMonth in year AYear.

element.name: EndOfAMonth.AYear
element.short: Year in which month occurs

element.name: EndOfAMonth.AMonth
element.short: Month to calculate end of

element.name: StartOfTheWeek
element.short: Return the first day of the week, given a date.
element.descr: StartOfTheWeek extracts the year and week parts of AValue and returns a TDateTime value with the date of the first day of that week as the function.

element.name: StartOfTheWeek.Result
element.short: First day of the week, in TDateTime format.

element.name: StartOfTheWeek.AValue
element.short: Day in the week.

element.name: EndOfTheWeek
element.short: Calculate a DateTime value which represents the end of a week, given a date in that week.
element.descr: EndOfTheWeek extracts the year and week parts of AValue and returns a TDateTime value with the date of the last day of that week as the function.

element.name: EndOfTheWeek.Result
element.short: DateTime value representing the last day of the week in which AVAlue is a day.

element.name: EndOfTheWeek.AValue
element.short: Day in the week of which the last day should be calculated.

element.name: StartOfAWeek
element.short: Return a day of the week, given a year, week and day in the week.

descr.p: StartOfAWeek returns a TDateTime value with the date of the indicated day of the week indicated by the AYear, AWeek, ADayOfWeek values.
The default value for ADayOfWeek is 1.

element.name: StartOfAWeek.Result
element.short: First day of the given week, in TDateTime format.

element.name: StartOfAWeek.AYear
element.short: Year

element.name: StartOfAWeek.AWeekOfYear
element.short: Week in the year

element.name: StartOfAWeek.ADayOfWeek
element.short: Day in the week (default 1)

element.name: EndOfAWeek
element.short: Return the last moment of day of the week, given a year and a week in the year.

descr.p: EndOfAWeek returns a TDateTime value with the date of the last moment (23:59:59:999) on the indicated day of the week indicated by the AYear, AWeek, ADayOfWeek values.
The default value for ADayOfWeek is 7.

element.name: EndOfAWeek.ADayOfWeek
element.short: Day of the week

element.name: StartOfTheDay
element.short: Calculate the start of the day as a DateTime value, given a moment in the day.

descr.p: StartOfTheDay extracts the date part of AValue and returns a TDateTime value with the date/time indication of the start (0:0:0.000) of this day.

element.name: StartOfTheDay.Result
element.short: Start of the day (00:00) as DateTime value

element.name: StartOfTheDay.AValue
element.short: DateTime from which to calculate start of the day.

element.name: EndOfTheDay
element.short: Calculate a datetime value that represents the end of a given day.

descr.p: EndOfTheDay extracts the date part of AValue and returns a TDateTime value with the date/time indication of the last moment (23:59:59.999) of this day.

element.name: EndOfTheDay.Result
element.short: A datetime value representing the time 23:59:59.999 of the day AValue.

element.name: EndOfTheDay.AValue
element.short: Day to calculate the end of

element.name: StartOfADay
element.short: Return the start of a day as a DateTime value, given a day indication

descr.p: StartOfADay returns a TDateTime value with the date/time indication of the start (0:0:0.000) of the day given by AYear, AMonth, ADay.
The day may also be indicated with a AYear, ADayOfYear pair.

element.name: StartOfADay.Result
element.short: Start of the given day as DateTime

element.name: StartOfADay.AYear
element.short: Year

element.name: StartOfADay.AMonth
element.short: Month in the year

element.name: StartOfADay.ADay
element.short: Day in the month.

element.name: StartOfADay.ADayOfYear
element.short: Day in the year.

element.name: EndOfADay
element.short: Calculates a DateTime value representing the end of a specified day

descr.p: EndOfADay returns a TDateTime value with the date/time indication of the last moment (23:59:59.999) of the day given by AYear, AMonth, ADay.
The day may also be indicated with a AYear, ADayOfYear pair.

element.name: EndOfADay.Result
element.short: A datetime value representing the time 23:59:59.999 of the given day.

element.name: EndOfADay.AYear
element.short: Year

element.name: EndOfADay.AMonth
element.short: Month in the year

element.name: EndOfADay.ADay
element.short: Day in the month

element.name: EndOfADay.ADayOfYear
element.short: Day of the year

element.name: MonthOfTheYear
element.short: Extract the month of a DateTime indication.

descr.p: MonthOfTheYear extracts the month part of Avalue and returns it. It is an alias for , and is provided for completeness only, corresponding to the other PartOfTheYear functions.
For an example, see the function.

element.name: MonthOfTheYear.Result
element.short: The month part of AValue

element.name: MonthOfTheYear.AValue
element.short: Date from which to extract month

element.name: WeekOfTheYear
element.short: Extract the week of the year (and optionally year) of a DateTime indication.

descr.p: WeekOfTheYear extracts the week of the year from Avalue and returns it, and optionally returns the year as well. It returns the same value as .
descr.remark: Note that weeks are numbered from 1 using the ISO 8601 standard, and the day of the week as well. This means that the year may not be the same as the year part of the date, since the week may start in the previous year as the first week of the year is the week with at least 4 days in it.

element.name: WeekOfTheYear.Result
element.short: Week of the year in which Avalue falls.

element.name: WeekOfTheYear.AValue
element.short: Date from which to extract week.

element.name: WeekOfTheYear.AYear
element.short: Year part of AValue

element.name: DayOfTheYear
element.short: Extracts the day of the year from a TDateTime value

descr.p: DayOfTheYear returns the number of days that have passed since the start of the year till the moment indicated by AValue. This is a one-based number, i.e. January 1 will return 1.
For an example, see the function.

element.name: DayOfTheYear.Result
element.short: Day of the year from AValue.

element.name: DayOfTheYear.AValue
element.short: DateTime to extract the day of the year from.

element.name: HourOfTheYear
element.short: Calculate the number of hours passed since the start of the year.

descr.p: HourOfTheYear returns the number of hours that have passed since the start of the year (January 1, 00:00:00) till the moment indicated by AValue. This is a zero-based number, i.e. January 1 00:59:59 will return 0.
For an example, see the function.

element.name: HourOfTheYear.Result
element.short: Number of hours passed since the start of the year till AValue .

element.name: HourOfTheYear.AValue
element.short: DateTime value for which to calculate the hour of the year

element.name: MinuteOfTheYear
element.short: Calculate the number of minutes elapsed since the start of the year

descr.p: MinuteOfTheYear returns the number of minutes that have passed since the start of the year (January 1, 00:00:00) till the moment indicated by AValue. This is a zero-based number, i.e. January 1 00:00:59 will return 0.
For an example, see the function.

element.name: MinuteOfTheYear.Result
element.short: Number of minutes elapsed since the start of the year.

element.name: MinuteOfTheYear.AValue
element.short: Moment in the year.

element.name: SecondOfTheYear
element.short: Calculate the number of seconds elapsed since the start of the year.

descr.p: SecondOfTheYear returns the number of seconds that have passed since the start of the year (January 1, 00:00:00) till the moment indicated by AValue. This is a zero-based number, i.e. January 1 00:00:00.999 will return 0.
For an example, see the function.

element.name: SecondOfTheYear.Result
element.short: Number of seconds elapsed since the start of the year.

element.name: SecondOfTheYear.AValue
element.short: Moment in the year

element.name: MilliSecondOfTheYear
element.short: Calculate the number of milliseconds elapsed since the start of the year.

descr.p: MilliSecondOfTheYear returns the number of milliseconds that have passed since the start of the year (January 1, 00:00:00.000) till the moment indicated by AValue. This is a zero-based number, i.e. January 1 00:00:00.000 will return 0.
For an example, see the function.

element.name: MilliSecondOfTheYear.Result
element.short: Number of seconds elapsed since the start of the year.

element.name: MilliSecondOfTheYear.AValue
element.short: Moment in the year

element.name: WeekOfTheMonth
element.short: Extract the week of the month (and optionally month and year) from a DateTime value

descr.p: WeekOfTheMonth extracts the week of the month from Avalue and returns it, and optionally returns the year and month as well (in AYear, AMonth respectively).
descr.remark: Note that weeks are numbered from 1 using the ISO 8601 standard, and the day of the week as well. This means that the year and month may not be the same as the year part of the date, since the week may start in the previous year as the first week of the year is the week with at least 4 days in it.

element.name: WeekOfTheMonth.Result
element.short: Week of the month

element.name: WeekOfTheMonth.AValue
element.short: Datetime value of which to calculate the week, month and year.

element.name: WeekOfTheMonth.AYear
element.short: Year part of AValue

element.name: WeekOfTheMonth.AMonth
element.short: Month part of AValue

element.name: DayOfTheMonth
element.short: Extract the day (of month) part of a DateTime value

descr.p: DayOfTheMonth returns the number of days that have passed since the start of the month till the moment indicated by AValue. This is a one-based number, i.e. the first day of the month will return 1.
For an example, see the function.

element.name: DayOfTheMonth.Result
element.short: Day in the month

element.name: DayOfTheMonth.AValue
element.short: Datetime value to extract day from.

element.name: HourOfTheMonth
element.short: Calculate the number of hours passed since the start of the month.

descr.p: HourOfTheMonth returns the number of hours that have passed since the start of the month till the moment indicated by AValue. This is a zero-based number, i.e. 00:59:59 on the first day of the month will return 0.
For an example, see the function.

element.name: HourOfTheMonth.Result
element.short: Number of hours passed since the start of the month till AValue.

element.name: HourOfTheMonth.AValue
element.short: DateTime value for which to calculate the hour of the month.

element.name: MinuteOfTheMonth
element.short: Calculate number of minutes elapsed since the start of the month.

descr.p: MinuteOfTheMonth returns the number of minutes that have passed since the start of the Month (00:00:00) till the moment indicated by AValue. This is a zero-based number, i.e. 00:00:59 on the first day of the month will return 0.
For an example, see the function.

element.name: MinuteOfTheMonth.AValue
element.short: Moment in the month.

element.name: SecondOfTheMonth
element.short: Calculate number of seconds elapsed since the start of the month.

descr.p: SecondOfTheMonth returns the number of seconds that have passed since the start of the month (00:00:00) till the moment indicated by AValue. This is a zero-based number, i.e. 00:00:00.999 on the first day of the month will return 0.
For an example, see the function.

element.short: Moment in the month.

element.name: WithinPastYears
element.short: Check whether two datetimes are only a number of years apart

descr.p: WithinPastYears compares the timestamps ANow and AThen and returns True if the difference between them is at most AYears years apart, or False if they are further apart.
descr.remark: Since this function uses the function to calculate the difference in years, this means that fractional years do not count, and the fractional part is simply dropped, so for two dates actually 2 and a half years apart, the result will also be True

element.name: WithinPastYears.Result
element.short: True if ANow and Athen are only AYears apart, false otherwise

element.name: WithinPastYears.ANow
element.short: First moment in time

element.name: WithinPastYears.AThen
element.short: Second moment in time

element.name: WithinPastYears.AYears
element.short: Number of years to check

element.name: YearsBetween
element.short: Calculate the number of whole years between two DateTime values
element.descr: YearsBetween returns the number of whole years between ANow and AThen. This number is an approximation, based on an average number of days of 365.25 per year (average over 4 years). This means the fractional part of a year is dropped.

element.short: Number of whole years between ANow and AThen.

element.name: YearsBetween.ANow

element.name: YearsBetween.AThen
element.short: Second moment in time

element.name: IncYear

element.descr: IncYear adds ANumberOfYears years to AValue and returns the resulting date/time. ANumberOfYears can be positive or negative.

element.name: RecodeYear

element.descr: RecodeYear replaces the year part of the timestamp AValue with AYear. All other parts of the date/time stamp are left untouched.

element.descr: RecodeMonth replaces the Month part of the timestamp AValue with AMonth. All other parts of the date/time stamp are left untouched.

If any of these values equals the pre-defined constant , then the corresponding part of the date/time stamp is left untouched.
element.errors: If one of the values AYear, AMonth, ADay, AHour, AMinute, ASecond AMilliSecond is not within a valid range (RecodeLeaveFieldAsIs excepted) then an EConvertError exception is raised.

element.name: TryRecodeDateTime
element.short: Replace selected parts of a TDateTime value with other values

descr.p: TryRecodeDateTime replaces selected parts of the timestamp AValue with the date/time values specified in AYear, AMonth, ADay, AHour, AMinute, ASecond and AMilliSecond. If any of these values equals the pre-defined constant , then the corresponding part of the date/time stamp is left untouched.
The resulting date/time is returned in AValue.
The function returns True if the encoding was succesful. It returns False if one of the values AYear, AMonth, ADay, AHour, AMinute, ASecond AMilliSecond is not within a valid range.

element.name: CompareDateTime
element.short: Compare 2 dates, taking into account the time of day

descr.p: CompareDateTime compares two timestamps A and B and returns the following results:

dl.dd: if A is earlier in date/time than B.
if A and B are the same date/time .
if A is later in date/time than B.

element.name: CompareDateTime.Result
element.short: A negative number if A is earlier than B, zero if they are equal, or positive if A is later than B.

element.name: CompareDateTime.A
element.short: First date-time to compare

element.name: CompareDateTime.B
element.short: First date-time to compare

element.name: CompareDate
element.short: Compare 2 dates, disregarding the time of day

descr.p: CompareDate compares the date parts of two timestamps A and B and returns the following results:

dl.dd: if the day part of A is earlier than the day part of B.
if A and B are the on same day (times may differ) .
if the day part of A is later than the day part of B.

element.name: CompareDate.Result
element.short: A negative number if date A is before B, zero if they are equal, or positive if A is after B.

element.name: CompareDate.A
element.short: First date to compare

element.name: CompareDate.B
element.short: Second date to compare

element.name: CompareTime
element.short: Compares two times of the day, disregarding the date part.

descr.p: CompareTime compares the time parts of two timestamps A and B and returns the following results:

dl.dd: if the time part of A is earlier than the time part of B.
if A and B have the same time part (dates may differ) .
if the time part of A is later than the time part of B.

element.name: CompareTime.Result
element.short: A negative number if A is before B, zero if they are equal, or positive A is later than B.

element.name: CompareTime.A
element.short: First time to compare

element.name: CompareTime.B
element.short: Second time to compare

element.name: InvalidDateTimeError
element.short: Raise an EConvertError about an invalid date-time specification.

descr.p: InvalidDateTimeError raises an EConvertError exception and formats the error message with an appropriate description made up from the parts AYear, AMonth, ADay,AHour, AMinute, ASecond and AMilliSecond.
Normally this function should not be needed, the conversion routines call it when they have received invalid arguments.

element.short: Invalid day of the year.

element.name: InvalidDateMonthWeekError
element.short: Raise an EConvertError exception when a Year,Month,WeekOfMonth,DayofWeek is invalid.

descr.p: InvalidDateMonthWeekError raises an EConvertError exception and formats the error message with an appropriate description made up from the parts AYear, Amonth, AWeekOfMonth and ADayOfWeek.
Normally this function should not be needed, the conversion routines call it when they have received invalid arguments.

element.name: InvalidDateMonthWeekError.AYear
element.short: Year

element.name: InvalidDateMonthWeekError.AMonth
element.short: Month of the year

element.name: InvalidDateMonthWeekError.AWeekOfMonth
element.short: Week of the month

element.name: InvalidDateMonthWeekError.ADayOfWeek
element.short: Day of the week

element.name: InvalidDayOfWeekInMonthError
element.short: Raise an EConvertError exception when a Year,Month,NthDayofWeek,DayofWeek is invalid.

descr.p: InvalidDayOfWeekInMonthError raises an EConvertError exception and formats the error message with an appropriate description made up from the parts AYear, Amonth, ANthDayOfWeek and ADayOfWeek.
Normally this function should not be needed, the conversion routines call it when they have received invalid arguments.
